message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DL, cs.DB, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the task of data fusion, which involves combining results from different search engines to improve performance. This task is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including information retrieval (cs.IR), computational linguistics (cs.CL), deep learning (cs.DL), databases (cs.DB), and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper specifically focuses on the evaluation of data fusion techniques, which is a common concern in information retrieval research (cs.IR). However, the proposed platform and its potential to reduce the burden of re-implementing algorithms could also be of interest to researchers in other sub-fields, such as deep learning and machine learning.
